message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I'm a primary or secondary school teacher from Flemish Community (Belgium). I need to provide one of five response options for each statement: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', or 'I don't know'.

Let me think about reasonable responses from a teacher's perspective in a realistic way:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is a positive application of AI that many teachers would recognize. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is also a positive capability that AI can offer for differentiation. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - This is also a positive application. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs (multilingual, SEN) - This is a positive application for accessibility. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is clearly a positive use case that many teachers would appreciate. I'll say "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a concern/risk. Most teachers would acknowledge this is a problem. I'll say "Agree" (that this is indeed a risk)

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is also a legitimate concern. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is another concern/risk. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a legitimate concern that many educators have. I'll say "Agree"


[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students - This is another risk worth acknowledging. I'll say "Agree"

I'm balancing recognition of AI's genuine benefits for lesson planning, personalization, and administrative efficiency with awareness of real risks around academic integrity, data security, and pedagogical appropriateness.

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - This is also a positive application. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs (multilingual, SEN) - This is a positive application for accessibility. I'll say "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is clearly a positive use case that many teachers would appreciate. I'll say "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a concern/risk. Most teachers would acknowledge this is a problem. I'll say "Agree" (that this is indeed a risk)

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is also a legitimate concern. I'll say "Agree"
